Reviews.Title: “Elite no way”
Reviews.Author: paul0629
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for a wedding as the groom was staying there. I wished he was staying somewhere else the reception was useless the food was rubbish even for rome the room was old dark and had no comforts expected from a city hotel ie no fridge coffe/tea facilities etc. The room was adequately clean. there is no bar so had to go next door to a good hotel. My wife had a lay in and went for breakfast 15 minutes before finish but everything was closed down, when she spoke to reception was informed the staff had gone home and there was a cafe over the road.The cost of the hotel was very expensive especially as it was rubbish. Our daughter booked a 4 star hotel on the outskirts of rome for 1/3 of the price which was very good.Elite it was but not in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: +ve 1. Nice location. Walking distance to metro station, Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. 2. Friendly service. We had a very early checkout (~4AM) but they arranged for us to have breakfast to go on their own (without us asking for it)! 3. Included continental breakfast was decent. -ve 1. Our standard room was tiny by American standards. 2. Hot water in our unit was for good for only one person at a time even though the room was reserved for 2 adults. We had to stagger our showers. 3. Hotel to airport transfer advertised at 45Euro has a 20Euro surcharage (which doesn't show up on their booking website) for outside daytime hours. Felt that was a bit steep given that early morning/late night there is no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Rome! book it now!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe Skye K
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Elite Hotel! We traveled to 5 countries in 11 days and this hotel was one of the top hotels that we've stayed. The lobby was super nice, modern white furniture, the staff were really friendly (thank you Claudia, the man who checked us in at midnight, the housekeeper, and the staff in breakfast area). The room was so big, modern decor, flat screen tv, comfy bed, they even gave us a basket of fruits and a flower! how nice! the bathroom was also nice, I love the big LUX soap that was attached to the wall, instead of small bottles that we usually get in other hotel. The housekeeper kept it clean everyday, they even put a card with the name of the housekeeper if you want to complain something. I left some chocolates that I brought from US for the housekeeper, hopefully she got it lol! But the best of all was the location! very close to Bernini station, bernini square, spanish steps/piazza di spagna, trevi fountain, and all the shopping area. We really had the best time in Rome, and I highly recommend his hotel! book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: georgiagi
Reviews.Content: I stood in the hotel two times. The first one it wasnt that good as the second time. The hotel was regenerated.It is now with good rooms. I have to say that the location is just perfect! Near to the metro station and to PIAZZA DI SPAGNA (my favorite spot in Rome).Totally recomend and I´m sure that I will return for a third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location 1 min from Spanish Steps and 5 mins from Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: Bev T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only 2 days before travel and I booked directly with the Hotel who also arranged the transfer from the airport. I received emails confirming booking and details of transport, the hotel was exactly as shown on the website so I was not disappointed, I booked a superior room which was contemporary well decorated and a lovely large bathroom with a fantastic shower. Breakfast was a let down with croissants, bread rolls and cake which was not to my taste but there was plenty to help yourself to. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly with lots of useful advice on what too see. Would definitely re visit. Only issue to mention is the noise from other rooms I could hear the guy in the next room snore lol, I am not a light sleeper so wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest you can find-did not stay”
Reviews.Author: takataka99
Reviews.Content: My wife was pregnant and they did not bother to inform us earlier by any means of not having room availability (although we had reservations for the room 1,5 months earlier and re-checked our reservations 10 days before we arrived). They moved us to another hotel, more distant to the place we wanted to be close to. And I repeat that, although my wife was pregnant, they did not even call for a taxi to take us to the other hotel they booked for us without informing us so we had to walk right after our long journey to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Annika E
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we were expecting from a two star hotel and much more. The lounge was very inviting and beautifully decorated. First impression of the personnel was good and it didn't change during our stay. They were always happy to help with our questions. Breakfast included only white bread and marmelades, which we expected. Our room was in the second floor and it was very nice. The traffic sounds were almost entirely muted, we heard some silent voices only from the room next to ours. The room was clean and bathroom too. We had our own shower and also a bathtub. You can also reserve a transportation from and to the airport. In the website they say it's a limousine, but it really is just a big car not like those the big stars drive with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location: we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: loproSydney
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at this Hotel. More of the rooms have been upgraded, and are clean, modern, "edgy" and all with plasma TV's. I think at this stage, you still have to request the "superior" rooms. The location is great: a short walk to Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. The breakfast room is fairly basic, and only serves up a continental breakfast, but is adequate to start the day. The staff, who all remembered us from our last trip, are very helpful and friendly; especially Claudia, An added bonus is the hairdresser on the first floor.....best colour and cut I have ever had!. We will be back and have recommended to all our friends and our travel agent

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Limbbatok
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying at the Elite hotel. It's just in between the Spanish Steps, Bernini Fountain and Trevi Fountain. Excellent, excellent location, considering the price you pay, it is truly value for money. The facilities are no great shakes, the door handles falling apart, the hot water running out after a while, but these are minor instances. The reception staff are very helpful and accommodating. Request to pack breakfast because we have an earlyt train to catch was see to without fuss. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Burple
Reviews.Content: There are two entrances into Elite, the foyer which is modern and well decorated. The other is a dimly lit passage way which has peeling paint on the walls. On our arrival we were upgraded to a superior room on the second floor. The reception staff were friendly and courteous, who were able to make good restaurant recommendations. Its apparent that the 2nd floor has been renovated including the superior rooms. Our room was modern and clean. Given the cost and star rating and central location we were pleasantly suprised by the standard. I would liken the room to travelodge accomodation. The hotel is ideally situated inbetween the trevi and spanish steps, both are only a 2 min walk away. The colleseum is a 15 min walk and the pantheon 10 mins. The only public transport we used during our 4 night stay was to travel to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: whistlerLeicester
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Elite, we were upgraded to a superior double with out asking, the staff were friendly and informative. The hotel was clean and the room comfortable. Yes the decor may have been tired, but we were pleasantly surprised after some of the negative reviews

Reviews.Title: “Stay only in the rooms fo the second floor”
Reviews.Author: t_statho
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two 'faces' If you only see the lobby and the renovated rooms, you would think it's a quality hotel. If you see the rest of the building, the breakfast hall, the elevator, the rest of the rooms, you would get a different idea. In general, the location is ideal, very close to the metro station and in the centre of Rome, on a walking distance to all the major sites. The rooms (the renovated ones in the second floor) are very good. We stayed in the new rooms and our impression was generally positive. I would say that all things considered (location and high cost of most of Rome's hotels) it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “FAB location”
Reviews.Author: Eliam
Reviews.Content: Great place, with good service. The location is excellent, and was excactly what i hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - 2 hotels in one!”
Reviews.Author: ANGELIKAKI
Reviews.Content: Elite hotel is a little bit complicated. Some rooms are renovated and others are in a bad/old condition. We have booked a standard room which was at the 1st floor.That was the worst room i have ever stayed.Old and tiny. The next day changed in a superior room(20€ upgrade).This room was tottaly different. New, spacious and modern.In this room we enjoyed our stay. It is important to say that the staff was very helpful & the location of the hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel because of location and very good service of stuff. Claudia is a great esset . Keep her!”
Reviews.Author: ofraha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small. Some rooms are renovated. If you order a renovated room il costs 20$ more. We stayed in the other room and it was o.k. the location is great' right near the Spanish stairs. The stuff is doing a wonderful job. Always happy to help and give advice. Claudia especially! We recomand to go to this hotel. Hahn family, Jerusalem, Israel

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianWoodBlog
Reviews.Content: We were most pleased with the location of the hotel-- between the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It was about a 5 minute walk to both sites. NOTE: to get to the hotel from the Spanga Metro stop, you will need to walk to the top of the Spanish Steps to Via Sistina then to Via Frencesco Crispi. We learned that the hard way! Be sure to buy a map at the airport. Our hotel room was clean, but very small. The bed was smaller than an American double bed, but it was fine. The shower was kind of odd. It was elevated, so to get into it, you had to take a large step up.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: Elanis
Reviews.Content: When I decided to book an affordable hotel in central Rome I expected to forfeit comfort, but this hotel was good value and surprisingly relaxing given it's central location. Our room overlooked the street, but the shutters and double glazing kept the majority of the Roman noise outside, and the air-conditioning was a godsend! Comfortable, very clean, and the staff were both friendly and helpful - providing excellent restaurant reccommendations too. The location was great, with most sights and attractions within easy walking distance. I would happily return to this hotel and will be reccommending it to my budget-savvy friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel, recently renovated room, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: tapdancer18
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel on our first visit to rome as the hotel had been recommended by a friend. Ideal location - walking distance to many of rome's tourist attractions. Room had been recently renovated and was very comoftable and thankfully air conditioned as the weather was quite warm. Our room overlooked the street which was quite busy but not too noisy. Only faults - Life very small and had to climb several sets of stairs to our room. No fridge in room and continental breakfast only. Good value as we had a superior room, the internet connection was free.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: jnorth85
Reviews.Content: from the lobby the hotel is pleasant to look at but once you pass throught the doorway into the hall and staircase it is a different story. the hotel is a construcyion site and very badly maintained. our room which was on the 5th floor, in a hotel that had no wroking elevator, was a joke. it was so small you could move passed the bed 2 at a time and there weas no tv or working aircon, and the champagne i ordered for 25 euros was tiny and warm in a bucket full of dirty warm water.....disgusting when i asked to change the room the clerk was extremely rude and said no it was too late so i asked for a refund and he refused saying thats what i paid for. after a long row he agreed to refund my money and we could leave with no cost, and gave me my credit card and passport details back.......neverless when i returned to london there was the charge of 150 euros to hotel elite. seriously this was the worst treatment i have had from a hotel, the staff and the hotel are awfull and i recommend that everybody looking at this hotel to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean, modern room.”
Reviews.Author: Marketer
Reviews.Content: Here is some context regarding our hotel choice in Rome. For my husband and I, we knew that we would not be at the hotel/in the room for very long since we would be out sightseeing. So staying in a 4-5 star was not a priority for us - we would rather save this for somewhere like Chianti where we tended to relax in the hotel. For context, when we go to the carribean we only stay in 5 star hotels and when it comes to food, dining , wine etc we are pretty discerning people. At the end of the day , we knew what to expect and what we were "getting in to" in advance. Here was our experience: * Room: Newly renovated, modern and abosolutely spotless. Very small but not that tiny for Rome standards. We stayed on 2nd floor and room looked on to building courtyard. * Mix of New and Old: Part of the hotel has been renovated (lobby, 2nd floor) but breakfast room , hallway, stairs and other floors have not been updated YET. The plan is to do this renovation next (according to staff). *Lobby: Great renovated lobby. Staff wasn't overly friendly but very courteous and helpful if we required assistance *Location: Can't beat this for the price and great shopping *Breakfast: Very basic but was enough to hold us over until lunch.

Reviews.Title: “it has issues to consider anyway i like it”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 2 in one one is a creepy aisle to a substandar breakfast room ,dirty stairs to less than average rooms the other is a nice and cool small reception to a dirty stairs to the second floor just redone which i loved i stayed at room 204 my friends at 209 (4) and 211(2) rates were 180 and 130 euros we book trough travel agent but i felt than in a direct booking can get a better deal new rooms are perfect you can see 2 set of photos at triadvisor and you will understand inmediately my point a good paint job to stairs can help a lot but it looks that the hotel owns some floors of the building so stairs are used by others owners (hair saloon ,etc) if you go with an open mind you will find a nice reception a beautiful modern room and a location that cannot be beated minutes from piazza spagna

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, good location - though the bathroom stinks!”
Reviews.Author: Xerrin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were planning on spending one night in Rome, and were in need of a central, yet budget, hotel. We weren't too fussy about where we stayed, as long as it was clean, basic, safe, and inexpensive. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. The staff were very helpful, and it is what I would have expected of a two star hotel in Rome. The breakfasts were also good, and the hotel was extremely central, which was a huge plus point. The major complaint we had was with the bathroom, since there was a horrible mouldy smell, possibly due to the humidity (even though everything was clean). This smell was so bad that we couldn't keep the bathroom door open at any time, since the smell would fill up the hotel room. However, since we were only staying for one night and did not spend much time in the hotel, we weren't extremely bothered by it. We might have asked to change rooms if we had been staying for longer. We only brought this to the attention of the staff upon check out, but had we mentioned it earlier I'm sure the staff would have accommodated us accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel--bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: sillehh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its location and low price. Yes, we should have been wary because of some of the other negative reviews, but we took a chance. We got to this hotel and saw the lounge, which is not pretty looking. Rather old white leather benches and kinda grimy old computers. We had booked a regular room at a special discount rate due to booking 6 months in advance. We checked in (after the man at the desk finished one phone call on the landline and another one on his cell phone and finally acknowledged our presence) and had the pleasure of getting our bags up to the third floor (that's what most Americans would call the fourth floor). There is an elevator, but you have to go up two medium flights of stairs to get there, and then another one or two flights after the elevator lets you off. Once we finally got to the room, we had an unpleasant surprise. The regular rooms are on par with a dirty hostel, and if that's what you want, there are cheaper ones and better ones near the Termini. Imagine old bed, dirty floor, bathroom so old that it can no longer look clean. Also, the bathtub had sides that are 3 ft high. I wanted to cry. Room 306 to be exact. I do have to say that the sheet did not look dirty. I went downstairs where the guy suddenly had trouble understanding English. I told him the room looked nothing like on the Internet and was dirty. After a long discussion he said the only thing we could do was upgrade by paying 20 euros a night for a superior room. I tried to bargain down with no success. Since we were way too tired to switch hotels, my husband looked at the superior rooms. They were definitely a step up from the regular rooms. However, still nothing to rave about. Room 208 had a double bed but the bathroom reeked so badly of mildew that it nearly knocked my husband over. We ended up picking room 201. Clean room with two twin beds pushed together. A clothes bar above the desk, a tiny bathroom. The floors were gray painted concrete with paint that would peel off in large chunks on your feet/socks/shoes. See photos. The bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom door was difficult to open and the towel hook was on the other side of the door from the shower. The shower had only a half glass door so the floor got drenched with every shower. The people at the front desk were clueless and unable to help most of the time. We asked where the buses left for Tivoli and they couldn't help. The computers kept on losing the Internet every 5 minutes and they blamed the Wifi when we could clearly see the strong Wifi signal. We asked for our room not to be cleaned (since we spent 10 mins on the first day wiping surfaces down with antiseptic wipes) and they couldn't even follow that simple request. Pluses of this hotel: Very close to the Trevi fountain. This was the main reason that we booked it. In hindsight, we used public transportation so much and things are so spread out in Rome that being so close to the fountain really didn't matter. In future trips we plan to stay near the Termini, which is a very easy place to get to on the buses. The Metro is generally good and fast but does not go to many areas of the city. One other surprising plus was a nice breakfast with coffee, water, juice, and tea as well as an assortment of pastries and jams/nutella/butter. All in all, we felt cheated as we were forced to pay an extra 60 euros for our 3 night stay. It actually was still a price that was near our goal 100 euro per night, but had we known we would have found a different hotel. Incidentally, we know we are not the only ones who felt bait-and-switched. While we were in the lounge trying to get the computer to work, a young couple came in with the same complaints as us - that their room was dirty and did not look like the picture on the website. The person at the desk told them that those pictures were of the superior rooms, and that there were no more rooms available to upgrade that night. I believe they ended up switching to a sister hotel of this one, owned by the same people - possibly the Accademia or the Tritone, or maybe one night at each. I don't know if they ended up paying a lot more for that, but I wouldn't be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel.It doesn't rate 1 star...not cheap”
Reviews.Author: mapjoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 1/2 finished ..barebones minumum. No Bell person had to lug everything upstairs. only one english speaking receptionon duty. cost was $375.00 2 nights . Location was the only reason we booked the hotel. You would be better off looking for a B&B.No charm ..No ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an even Better Location. A rebutle to all the nasty things people said.”
Reviews.Author: kallirache
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel for the location before we read any reviews. when we did read the reviews we were horrified how much people didnt like it. so on the day of arriving there we were dreading it but as soon as we entered the front door all we could think was "ARE YOU SERIOUSE!!!!!!!!" the lobby was spotless, with funky white leather couches and big screen tv yet the pictures on the wall gave it a slight homey feel. The receptionist was friendly and straight away told us about a few places to eat around our hotel and what there is to see. ok we thought, maybe the room is what people didnt like........ Before i go on may i just say that we didnt get a suit or anything it was a standered double bed room...... as you enter there was a small hallway like think with a FULL LENGTH mirror (to a woman it is molto importante) and a HUGE wardrobe. the room itself wasnt huge but there was a little desk and bedside tables and a big bed and a large window. The bathroom was opposite the bed and had a sliding door. This is where some reviews we read on the internet begun to sound a bit ridiculas. One said that the shower tank thing was right above the head and they had to crouch down to have a shower!!!!!! well i dont know how it is in other rooms but the one we had was so high up you had to be Shaquil O'Neal to reach it :) yes it might be small for 4 people but for 2 people who were there for a week and wanted to see the city it was more than enough! it was always clean,the sheets and towels were changed daily and the breakfast was simple but tastey! the location was the best part though...it was 2 mins from the spanish steps and we could walk almost anywhere...the trevi fountin, piaza novana...everything was within reach!and this hotel was one of the cheap ones when we booked it on expedia in september. if you are looking for a comfy city break look no further!!!!!!!!!! and my friends stayed there a couple of months after us and they said the same things as i did!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lori021
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in Rome for 1 night in September. Rome is a very big city but hotel is close to everything, spanish steps and trevi fountain just 2 mins walking, metro station barberini and termini train station very near. Staff is friendly and very helpful, they care about every request, they made us feel at home. Room and bathroom were new, good size and very clean. The breakfast was included with good quality food (italian style, very good cappuccino). The reception is new, in white color, there are some pcs were you can use the internet for reasonable fares. I would definetly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, passable hotel”
Reviews.Author: magentas
Reviews.Content: Overall adequate if you don't plan to spend any time in your hotel room, otherwise look elsewhere. Location excellent, close to everything. Security in hotel seemed ok. Room small but space enough with old fashioned unappealing tired decor in bedroom and antiquated bathroom. The shower functioned ok. Reasonably quiet and clean with window shutters that screen out the light & an opening window - not much of a view however. Mattress and pillows old, hard & lumpy, very uncomfortable & urgently needing replacing. So bad I would have bought a pillow if I could have located one nearby! Breakfast was awful, no healthy options - fake orange juice, limp croissant, jam tart and cake, the same everyday. Front desk staff cordial except for one whose abruptness came across as rudeness (unintended I believe but a bit off putting)... The hotel is suitable for the budget conscious travellor seeking a great location who can overlook the negatives. Rome is expensive, but I would suggest that this hotel is not worth more than 90 euros max for a double/twin room. Do not buy from the fruit stall at Trevi fountain, very, very expensive. Locate the supermarket nearby asap for cheaper bottled water & food.

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed in a place as bad as this”
Reviews.Author: Clint5
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for it's location. It is a perfect location. Once we arrived I tried to cancel my reservations. We are not picky travelers but this was to much. The window air conditioners didn't work and we had two fans, one that worked. While my wife and I were trying to stay cool with the fan in the middle of a very hot day a fellow from the office can in without knocking and tried to take the one fan that worked. I have to grab the fan to keep it. He said I already had a fan. I told him the air conditioning didn't work and the other fan didn't. Also the place was dirty, run down. Rome is such a beautiful place and it's hard to imagine that a place could cause such a bring down.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: prome88
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Rome in September and stayed at the hotel for two days. This is a quiet and clean hotel. We walked in off the street to make our reservation. The staff was friendly and helpul. Our room overlooked a small courtyard. Our only complaint was that the bathtub was too small and the bedspread was a bit old looking (but it was clean). It is very convenient to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Overall we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “3a location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Lihengmei
Reviews.Content: The lacation is excellent, very close to Spanish steps, piazza Popolo, trevi fountain and the main shopping streets as via del Corso, via Condotti. The room was small but comfortable, not luxurus but clean, they made the bed everyday and cleaned the sheets. Very quiet at night, good modern aircon. The staff very friendly. Breaksfast included, was simple but fresh and nice. Paid 150 euro/night/double room, expensive, but everything is in Rome. I found a nice restaurant where the locals eat, good food and reasonable prices, excellent service, "Il Galeone" Piazza S. Cosimato 27, Trestevere, on the other side of Tiber River. On via del Tritone take bus 62, 63 or 492, get off in Largo Argentina and take tram 8, then after crossing the bridge, get off at a big white building from a Ministry. You can not miss it. You will enjoy the (short) ride in the bus and tram to see the city. Avoid eating or drinking at the restaurants around the St. Peter's basilica, very expensive and very bad quality, not even fresh food. Rome is a wonderful city, full of history, culture and art. We fell in love with the city. Also shopping for shoes and clothes was cheaper and nicer than many other european cities.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Poitiers
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Ok - Where do I start. The reception staff are horrible. Absolutely the most unfriendly people ever - rude, unhelpful, arrogant --- DO NOT STAY HERE ! The room was below average -- to get there (With our heavy suitcases) we had to go to the first floor to get the lift ! The bedroom was small but clean. The bathroom was about 100 years old and dirty. The shower (If I could call it that) was a disgrace - I had to crouch down as they installed a boiler right there under where the shower sits -- Crazy stuff. I meant to take photos to put them on her but I didn't get the chance as I was there for a wedding. On that point -- Most of the wedding party were staying next door in Hotel Cecil which appeared to ber very nice. I was best man and the groom staying next door tried to drop something up to my room but was refused -- they wanted to see a passport ! to drop something up to the room. DO NOT STAY HERE. Off the bathroom was a balcony which was boareded up so we had a tiny old battered window looking onto a dirty alley. The reception area looks great but don't be fooled. I have never stayed in hostels in Oz or anything like that so maybe I'm spoiled but let me assure you -- I wouldn't stay here ever again. This is the first review I have placed on this or any site and I registered with Trip advisor to warn people. I hope this has helped and hope that you won't book this hotel. We paid €600 for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: crafter188
Reviews.Content: As already mentioned the location of this hotel is fantastic! Once we figured out the map, and got used to the confusing streets, we found that this hotel is perfectly situated to explore Rome. The Spanish Steps are almost right around the corner! A very good map is available at the front desk, and the staff are wonderfully helpful. The room we had (#205) was a double with a wonderfully comfortable bed and air conditioning that worked. It overlooked Via Francesco Crispi, so there was intermittent noise at night. When we were there, the hotel was fully booked but very quiet – probably other hotel guests falling into their bed, exhausted as we did!!! Our room was very small, but it was immaculately clean. Bathroom was tiny too and shower was a bit of a challenge, but again clean and functional. Each room seems to have its own hot water tank, so we never ran out of hot water, except for the time that we shut the tank off by accident!!! Watch the switches on the bathroom wall! We had breakfast at the hotel everyday, which consisted of orange juice, coffee, tea, croissants, buns, and a couple of pastry items. It was the same every day, so a bit monotonous, but excellent coffee. If you want an espresso or cappuccino, you just have to ask Lucia, who is tending to the breakfast area. There are many stairs in this hotel, with a extremely small elevator that you have to take some stairs to get to. There is no safe deposit box in the room or available at the front desk, which was a bit of a worry, but we were fortunate to have no issues with our passports being stolen. It really feels like a small family-run hotel. A wonderful thing about Rome is that the water is delicious. We carried water bottles with us everywhere and refilled them from the public fountains. Save your money on water, and spend it on the excellent wine and beer (ha)! There’s a small supermarket on the way to the Trevi Fountain, which was handy for snacks and the aforementioned wine. Ask at the front desk for directions to Despar. There are also many little restaurants, serving food that is familiar and delicious. My kids loved being able to eat pasta every day, but we sure enjoyed our potatoes when we got home! We liked the look of the sidewalk tables, but always chose a table inside in the air conditioning. On our last night, we dined at one of the many restaurants near the Piazza de Barberini. It’s an easy walk to the Metro, which takes you one way to the Vatican or the other way to the Bus/Train Terminal. We booked a tour of the Vatican Museums with Viator. I would highly recommend this tour. There’s so much to see that we would have been overwhelmed and then not fully appreciated what we did see. Our tour guide was excellent, and you are given headphones, so you don’t have to be right beside her to hear her commentary. We booked a “hop on, hop off” bus tour one day, which took us to the Colosseum and onward. The Coliseum was interesting, but I feel that we would have got more out of it if we would have booked either a tour or rented an audio guide. Same with the Roman Forum; we walked around, but really didn’t understand what we were seeing, and there isn’t a lot of information to be had on site. A good tip is to walk to the entrance of the Palatine Hill to buy your ticket for the Colosseum. The line is shorter here, so you spend less time standing waiting for your adventure to begin. We took the fast train to Napoli and then the local train to Pompeii. It was very interesting, but again not a lot of information on site, so we were glad to have done some research ahead of time. Pompeii is a large area, so you can expect to do a lot of walking and it’s a full day excursion. All the Roman people we encountered were so friendly and helpful, but be prepared to spend time standing on a street corner trying to figure out where you are on the map, and where you need to go. This was our first trip to Europe, so we were enthralled by the narrow streets, old buildings, business people on scooters and beautiful piazzas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: aviatorlady
Reviews.Content: Best price thru Venere. Fantastic location to walk to Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. We had a quad room which was a good size for European rooms. Very clean. The bathroom was another story. Needs restoration soon or it will just fall thru to the floor below. The parquet floor was peeling up from previous water damage. The shower filled up fast if you weren't careful, and the hot water ran out quickly. We discovered that with 4 people, each had to only turn on the water in short bursts so as not to over-run the pan or use up the hot water. If you can live with that, the rest was fine. It was quiet with the window closed even facing the street. It was bright when the shutters were open. Continental breakfast was included and was ok. Free internet. The staff were very nice and extremely helpful. I hope they renovate soon, because I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: BavariaRuss
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I can say about the Elite hotel is the two young ladies and young man working the front desk are nice. My room was very small, the bathroom tiny with antiquated plumbing (miniature bathtub only, about half the size of standard). The "bed" was a cot like thing with an old, worn out mattress. The place was filthy- ring around the bottom of the tub, bathroom smelled like urine the whole time, walls around bed filthy. Cleaning lady did not replace bathroom floor mat and towels. Also, bizarre sliding door thing in room that would not close, opened into mechanical area or something. Had I not prepaid as part of package, I would have walked and took my chances somewhere else, I almost did anyway. There are much, much nicer (or at least to western standard) rooms available in Rome at this price to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: fraidofflying
Reviews.Content: I booked this place through American Airlines, and what a rip! I paid $268.68 a nite, inclusive of taxes. American dollars. Had I paid $150 a nite, OK. I must admit that it was scrupulously clean, every day, and the location was great. You can easily walk to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, the Borghese Gardens and Galleria, the four fountains corner in Rome. But. The rooms were small, and the decor was something out of early 50s B-flics. Especially the common room, which did have free internet. And we could call back to the States for 10cents a minute. Very dark, long hall, and the desk clerk at nite could not really speak any English. And the breakfast, whew! Nasty coffee with that milk offered that can stay on a shelf for months, just a few old pastries and rolls, horrible something that I guess was supposed to be juice. Just awful. I most definitely would not stay here again, at any price. Hotels in Rome are a dime a dozen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Placed but very old and dark”
Reviews.Author: pgomag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect placed and the staff was nice but is very very old and dark. Just to sleep and take a shower, nothing else.....It was not cheap (120€ per night), our room was very little, very dark (just a little window without sun) and with a very old furnitures.....

HotelInfo.Name: Elite Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 49 Via Francesco Crispi, 00187 Rome, Italy
